duties_responsibilities.duty: Operates X-Ray equipment in the examination of patients in accordance with standard procedure and physician's instructions.
Provides treatment/care to pediatric, adolescent, adult and geriatric patients.
Maintains a positive attitude and demonstrates appropriate communication of information to all ages.
Responsible for the operation and maintenance of equipment, including routine maintenance, ordering of supplies, and cleaning.
Applies knowledge of the principles of radiation protection for the patient, self, and others.
Determines exposure factors to achieve optimum radiographic technique with a minimum of radiation exposure to the patients.
Applies knowledge of PACS or HIS to provide quality images for interpretation.
Follows HIPAA Guidelines and maintains compliance with appropriate health and safety regulatory agencies.
Performs scheduling, referrals, appointments, ancillaries, surgeries, hospital admissions, medical records, documentation, and works with forms and charts.

Performs phlebotomy, specimen collection and processing, medication management, inventory management, and patient care, including exam room preparation & maintenance and conducting patient interviews.

Provides support and guidance for clinical policies and procedures, precertification/authorization, coding, E & M / Basic Visits, office procedures/complex visits, surgeries, hospital services, correspondence, statistical reports, accounts payable, and payroll.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or Equivalent. Currently possess and maintain SCRQSA certification for Limited Practice Radiographer in at least one of the following designations: General, Chest, Podiatric, Chiropractic and/or Bone Densitometry. Successful completion of an educational course or program that meets the requirements of the SCRQSA; Familiar with all phases of anatomy and exhibits ability to understand related function of radiology computer; Must possess skills necessary to treat patients of all ages.
